SEARCH
Package project.star_wars_universe.data

Class AppDataManager

java.lang.Object
project.star_wars_universe.data.AppDataManager
public class AppDataManager extends Object
A singleton class that manages the application data and tracks the opened file. This class is written using the singleton pattern, because there should only be one entity that manages the application data - otherwise unexpected behaviours may occur (such as data loss).

  • Constructor Details

    • AppDataManager

      private AppDataManager()
      Initializes the class. This constructor is private in accordance to the rules for implementing the singleton pattern.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AppDataManager getInstance()
      Gets the AppDataManager singleton instance. Here, the lazy loading approach is used - the singleton instance is only created when it is first accessed.
      Returns:
      the AppDataManager singleton instance.

    • loadAppData

      public void loadAppData(File file) throws ParsingFailureException, DataLoadingException, IOException
      Loads data into the application. First the File from which data should be loaded is assigned to the openedFile field. Secondly, the data from the file is retrieved. If it is not empty, the data is first parsed using the Parser of the specified File into an AppData object. Then, the application data is loaded using the jediDataLoader for the jedi data and the planetsDataLoader for the planets data respectively.
      Parameters:
      file - the file from which data should be loaded.
      Throws:
      ParsingFailureException - if an exception occurs during the parsing the file data.
      DataLoadingException - if an exception occurs during the loading of the data into the application.
      IOException - if an exception occurs while the file is being read.

    • unloadAppData

      public void unloadAppData()
      Unloads the application data. The openedFile is set to null to signify that there is now no opened file. The jedi data is unloaded using the jediDataLoader and the planets data is unloaded using the planetsDataLoader.

    • saveAppData

      public void saveAppData(File file) throws SerializationFailureException, IOException
      Saves the application data to the specified file. First the Lists of Jedi and Planets are retrieved from the JediRepository and the PlanetsRepository respectively. Then they are used to create an AppData object. The object gets serialized using the Serializer of the specified File and afterwards it is written to it.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to which the application data should be written.
      Throws:
      SerializationFailureException - if an exception occurs during the serialization of the applicaton data.
      IOException - if an exception occurs while the file is being written to.

    • getOpenedFile

      public File getOpenedFile()
      Gets the currently opened file.
      Returns:
      the currently opened file or null if no file is opened at the moment.
